paper_abstract: TO MEET RAPIDLY GROWING PERFORMANCE DEMANDS AND ENERGY CONSTRAINTS, FUTURE CHIPS WILL LIKELY FEATURE THOUSANDS OF ON-DIE RESOURCES. EXISTING NETWORK-ON-CHIP SOLUTIONS WEREN'T DESIGNED FOR SCALABILITY AND WILL BE UNABLE TO MEET FUTURE INTERCONNECT DEMANDS. A HYBRID NETWORK-ON-CHIP ARCHITECTURE CALLED KILO-NOC CO-OPTIMIZES TOPOLOGY, FLOW CONTROL, AND QUALITY OF SERVICE TO ACHIEVE SIGNIFICANT GAINS IN EFFICIENCY.
paper_title: A QOS-ENABLED ON-DIE INTERCONNECT FABRIC FOR KILO-NODE CHIPS
